Delegate Biographies

Tim Reynolds (Cambridge, MA)

Tim Reynolds attended his first competition in 2005, and has been to over a hundred competitions since. He has broken the US National Record for Fewest Moves several times, and twice for Pyraminx. Tim started organizing when he attended college at MIT, and now plays a major role in the organization of Worlds and US Nationals. Tim is known for his friendliness and his ability to keep his cool; he often jokes around with competitors, notably giving a short speech about why competitors must not drop their pizza off at the cube drop-off table. Tim also enjoys running, and currently works for Google in Cambridge.

[2005REYN01]

Kian Barry (Branchburg, NJ)

Kian is known for never sending people biographies.

[2007BARR01]

Bob Burton (Belleville, NJ)

Bob Burton is one of the most famous speedcubers in the United States. He first started speedcubing in 2001, and was well known for his record-breaking Magic, Master Magic, and Clock times. He also started cubewhiz.com where he posts resources for beginners and advanced cubers for various puzzles. Bob teaches math in the Bronx, New York, and is the Senior Delegate for the Eastern US and Canada. Bob was married at the Liberty Science Center, the venue of US Nationals 2014, on Pi Day of 2015 (3-14-15).

[2003BURT01]

Felix Lee (Clarksville, MD)

Felix Lee learned how to solve a Rubik's Cube in 2007 and started attending competitions in 2008. He became better known as a speedcuber when he broke the Pyraminx North American record using his own method and was eventually ranked third in the world. Felix started organizing competitions in 2010, which helped revitalize the cubing scene in Maryland, and is now an organizer for US Nationals. Felix currently studies computer science and mathematics at the University of Maryland.

[2008LEEF01]

Arthur Adams (New Haven, CT)

Arthur started attending cube competitions in early 2006, and organized a few competitions during his time as a college student at Brown University. After a brief time on the west coast he's back in New England as a graduate student in astronomy at Yale. He has helped out at several US National competitions and one Worlds as a staff member. Unlike Tim and Felix, he's only broken the national record for Pyraminx once.

[2006ADAM01]

Sam Schultz (New York City, NY)

Sam Schultz started cubing in 2011, and has regularly attended competitions ever since. He soon started helping out at competitions and has been a huge help in making sure events stay on schedule. He co-organized Lexington competitions from Fall 2014 to Summer 2016 and served on US Nationals staff in 2015 and 2016. Sam is also an avid saxophone player and Chipotle customer. He will attend New York University in the fall of 2016.

[2011SCHU06]
